info.title: API 2.0
info.description: Early release of version 2.0 of the Vend API.

tags.name: Channel request log
tags.description: A log of requests and responses between Vend and an integration channel.

get.description: Returns a list of request log records.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: Limit the requests to 1 or more status codes.

parameters.name: request_method
parameters.description: Limit the requests to 1 or more request methods.

parameters.name: occurred_before
parameters.description: Limit requests to before this RFC3339 date.

parameters.name: occurred_after
parameters.description: Limit requests to after this RFC3339 date.

parameters.name: status_code_before
parameters.description: Limit requests to those with status codes less than this value.

parameters.name: status_code_after
parameters.description: Limit requests to those with status codes greater than this value.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: If provided, request logs will be limited to the supplied channel id. If no id is provided, only requests logged with no channel id will be returned. Requests with no channel id indicate requests made during the setup process.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of gift cards.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The upper limit for the ID to be included in the response.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to be returned in the response. NOTE: 200 is the maximum value of the page_size parameter.

parameters.name: card_number
parameters.description: Find by gift card number.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by gift card status.

200.description: The gift card list was successfully retrieved.

post.description: Creates and activates a new gift card. The gift card will be created with one transaction with status "ACTIVATION" which contains the initial balance of the gift card.

parameters.name: GiftCardActivationParams
parameters.description: Create gift card parameters

422.description: Gift card has already been created and activated.

post.description: Used to import a csv file of previously exported gift cards.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The name of the csv file to import.

get.description:
Finds and returns the given card number. Returns a 404 if the card does not exist.

Within the gift card structure returned is the field gift__card__transactions which contains a list of all the transactions associated with the gift card. In this this list you will see one or more of the following statuses:

* "ACTIVATION" - This transaction type is added automatically when the gift card is created. The amount will be the initial balance that was loaded onto the gift card.
* "REDEEMING" - This status indicates the customer used their gift card to pay for one or more items. The amount MUST be negative.
* "IMPORTING" - You should only see this if gift cards were imported into the gift card system.
* "VOIDING" - You will see this status if the gift card has been voided. Note that the balance of the card is set to zero when the gift card is voided.
* "EXPIRING" - This transaction is added automatically when the gift card expires. Again note that the balance is set to zero when the gift card expires.
* "REVERSING" - This status indicates that a given transaction was reversed.
* "RELOADING" - This status means that more credit was loaded onto the gift card.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of the gift card to find.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of the gift card to be voided.

404.description: The gift card was not found.

post.description:
Creates a new gift card transaction. The two most important fields for creating a new gift card transaction are the number of the gift card and the type of the transaction. The type determines what sort of transaction it is.
 
* "REDEEMING" - Use this type when you want to redeem a certain amount from the gift card balance. The amount MUST be negative. If you want to add an amount to the balance use the "RELOADING" type.  
* "RELOADING" - Use this type when you load a new amount onto a gift card. 

If the gift card does not have enough credit to honour the transaction a 422 HTTP status code will be returned.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of the gift card to add the transaction to.

parameters.name: GiftCardActivationParams
parameters.description: Create gift card transaction parameters

404.description: The gift card was not found.

422.description: The gift card does not have enough credit to process this transaction.

get.description: Finds and returns the card associated with the given transaction id. Returns a 404 if the gift card with the given transaction id was not found.
get.summary: Find gift card by transaction id

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: The transaction id of the gift card transaction to find.

200.description: The gift card with this transaction id was successfully found.

404.description: The gift card associated with the transaction id was not found.

delete.description: Reverse the given transction on the gift card. If the transaction is successful a new transaction will be added to the gift card transactions with the status "REVERSING".

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: The transaction id to be reversed for the gift card.

200.description: The gift card transaction was successfully reversed

get.description:
This endpoint allows integrators to search all of the most commonly used resources, **sales**, **products** and **customers**. Each type allowing search by a number of different parameters.

### Supported resource types and attributes

- **Sales**
  - date_from
  - date_to
  - status
  - invoice_number
  - customer_id
  - user_id
  - outlet_id
- **Products**
  - sku
  - supplier_id
  - brand_id
  - tag_id
  - product_type_id
  - variant_parent_id
- **Customers**
  - customer_code
  - first_name
  - last_name
  - company_name
 
### Sorting and pagination

Unlike other endpoints in the API 2.0, search results from this endpoint can be sorted by any of the attributes above. Because of that, the default [pagination](https://docs.vendhq.com/v0.9/reference#section-api-2-0) mechanism is not appropriate for this endpoint. Instead, this endpoint uses `offset` and `page_size` attributes to handle search results spanning multiple pages.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The enity type to search for. One of: `sales`, `products`, `customers`.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: The attribute used to sort items returned in the response.

parameters.name: order_direction
parameters.description: Sorting direction. One of: `asc`, `desc`.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to be included in the response, currently limited to 10000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of objects to be "skipped" for the response. Used for pagination.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The `id` of the object to be included in the response.

parameters.name: -_id
parameters.description: The `id` of the object to be excluded from the response.

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Indicated whether deleted objects should be included in the response.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
**SALES** Status of the sale to find.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: invoice_number
parameters.description: **SALES** Invoice number of the sale.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: **SALES** The `ID` of the customer associated with the sales.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: **SALES** The `ID` of the user associated with the sales.

parameters.name: outlet_id
parameters.description: **SALES** The `ID` of the outlet associated with the sales.

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: **SALES** Lower limit for the sale date as UTC timestamp. Format: `2016-08-08T12:00:00Z`.

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: **SALES** Upper limit for the sale date as UTC timestamp. Format: `2016-08-08T12:00:00Z`.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The SKU of products to include in the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: -sku
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The SKU of products to exclude from the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: supplier_id
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The ID of the supplier associated with the product to include in the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: -supplier_id
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The ID of the supplier associated with the product to exclude from the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: brand_id
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The ID of the brand associated with the product to include in the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: -brand_id
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The ID of the brand associated with the product to exclude from the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: tag_id
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The ID of the tag associated with the product to include in the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: -tag_id
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The ID of the brand associated with the product to exclude from the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: product_type_id
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The ID of the product type associated with the product to include in the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: -product_type_id
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The ID of the product type associated with the product to exclude from the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: variant_parent_id
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The ID of the variant parent product associated with the product to include in the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: -variant_parent_id
parameters.description:
**PRODUCTS** The ID of the variant parent product associated with the product to exclude from the search.
Can be used multiple times to search for objects with different values of this parameter.

parameters.name: customer_code
parameters.description: **CUSTOMERS** The `customer_code` associated with the customer to find.

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: **CUSTOMERS** The `first_name` for the customers to find.

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: **CUSTOMERS** The `last_name` for the customers to find.

parameters.name: company_name
parameters.description: **CUSTOMERS** The `company_name` for the customers to find.

get.description:
This endpoint lists all promotions for a retailer.

There are optional query parameters that allow filtering promotions. They can't be combined:

 * `end_time_from` - only show promotions that have end_time after or equal to this time 
 * `end_time_to` - only show promotions that have end_time before this time

For example. the time format for end_time_from and end_time_to are: `2047-06-21T13:00:00`

parameters.name: end_time_to
parameters.description: Upper limit for the promotion end date as UTC timestamp. Format: `2020-08-08T12:00:00Z`.

parameters.name: end_time_from
parameters.description: Lower limit for the promotion end date as UTC timestamp. Format: `2020-08-08T12:00:00Z`.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to be returned in the response.

post.description:
This endpoint creates a new promotion. 

It responds with the newly-created promotion, including the promotion's ID.

get.description: This will retrieve a single promotion using the given ID.

put.description:
This endpoint updates an existing promotion by ID. 

 * All of a promotion's fields except its id may be updated. 
 * There are no partial updates. 
 * All fields must be specified in the update.
 * The response contains the updated promotion object.

get.description:
Get a list of products applicable for this promotion, and their discount price.

It takes in `page_size`, `offset` and `name` (use for searching product by product name) as query parameters.

The endpoint returns:
 * a list of products with discount for the condition product set, and
 * another list for the action product sets.

get.summary: Get the promo codes for a promotion
get.description: Get the promo codes associated with this promotion.

post.summary: Get the active status of promo codes
post.description: Get promo codes, with their associated promotions.

post.summary: Apply discounts to a sale object
post.description:
This will find the best possible promotion to a sale, apply it and return the sale and the discount.

 * Despite its `POST` method, this endpoint does not modify any server-side state.
 * It is the caller's responsibility to pass along the full details of the sale, including all customer information and product information (product type, tags, etc.).

quantity.description: Quantity, if required by the action type.

min_quantity.description: Minimum quantity, if required by the action type.

max_quantity.description: Maximum quantity, if required by the action type.

data.description: An array of Brand objects wrapped in top level `data` object.

Channel.title: Channel
Channel.description: An object representing a single channel.

channel_type.description: The type of channel this is.

register_id.description: The Vend register id that sales will be associated to.

payment_type_id.description: The Vend payment type id that sale payments will be associated to.

inventory_outlet_ids.description: The Vend outlet ids that count towards inventory.

created_at.description: An RFC3339 representation of the time at which the channel was created.

sales_last_imported_at.description: An RFC3339 representation of the time at which sales were last imported.

products_last_imported_at.description: An RFC3339 representation of the time at which products were last imported.

ChannelCollectionResponse.title: Channels response
ChannelCollectionResponse.description: A collection of channel records wrapped in a top-level data object.

Condition.title: Condition

quantity.description: Quantity, if required by the condition type.

min_price.description: Minimum price, if required by the condition type.

min_quantity.description: Minimum quantity, if required by the condition type.

max_quantity.description: Minimum quantity, if required by the condition type.

Condition.description: A condition to determine whether a promotion should apply to a sale.

outlet_id.description: A valid ID of an outlet where stock will be received.

received_at.description: 11-30T19:08:541+00:00 (timestamp) - The date when consignment was received.

source_outlet_id.description: A valid ID of an outlet where stock will come from. **Stock transfers only**.

total_cost_gain.description: The cost of items over the expected level.

total_count_loss.description: The number of items below the expected level.

total_cost_loss.description: The cost of items below the expected level.

total_count_gain.description: The number of items over the expected level.

data.description: An array of consignment objects wrapped in a top level `data` object.
An array of consignment products.

customer_code.description: Customer code used for claiming loyalty.

gender.description: Customer's gender. Can be `M`, `F` or null.

do_not_email.description: Indicates whether the customer opted out of email communications.

custom_field_1.description: Custom field 1. Can be used to store random data.

customer_code.description: Customer code used for claiming loyalty.

gender.description: Customer's gender. Can be `M`, `F` or null.

do_not_email.description: Indicates whether the customer opted out of email communications.

data.description: An array of Customer objects.
An array of customer group objects wrapped in top level `data` object.

DiscountLineItem.title: Line Item, for use while applying a discount

unit_price.description: The unit price for the line item.

price_adjusted.description: Indicator to suggest that the price has been adjusted manually, such as through a discount.

confirmed.description: Whether the line item is confirmed as part of a layby or on account sale.

explicit_loyalty_value.description: Whether loyalty was explicitly set in the product or it just uses the default outlet ratio.

unit_tax_discount.description: The line item's unit tax discount

promotion_ids.description: List of promotion IDs applied to this line item.

DiscountSaleParam.title: Sale object for use in a Discount request

total_price.description: Total (tax exclusive) price of the sale

DiscountResponse.title: DiscountParam consists of a Sale, and related information to check if a promotion applies, and to calculate the discount

DiscountResponseParam.title: DiscountParam consists of a Sale, and related information to check if a promotion applies, and to calculate the discount

DiscountParam.title: DiscountParam consists of a Sale, and related information to check if a promotion applies, and to calculate the discount

promo_code.description: The promo code to apply to this sale

channel.description: The channel where the sale is coming from

outlet_id.description: The outlet ID for this sale

is_tax_inclusive.description: Indication whether the sale is tax inclusive or tax exclusive

balance.description: The balance of the gift card.

total_sold.description: the amount loaded onto this gift card during activation or reloading.

total_redeemed.description: The amount redeemed with this gift card.

gift_card_transactions.description: An array of Gift Card Transactions.

amount.description: The amount to be loaded onto the gift card.

number.description: The number of the gift card.

sale_id.description: The sale id of the sale

user_Id.description: The user id of the user creating the gift card.

expires_at.description: The expiry date time of the gift card.

time_zone.description: The timezone of the date times for the gift card.

amount.description: The amount to be loaded onto the gift card.

user_id.description: The user id of the user creating the gift card.

client_id.description: The client id is a unique transaction identifier, optionally provided by the client.

expires_at.description: The expiry date time of the gift card.

time_zone.description: The timezone of the date times for the gift card.

data.description: An array of Gift Cards.

user_id.description: The User ID associated with the transaction.

client_id.description: The client id is a unique transaction identifier, optionally provided by the client.

product_id.description: The ID of the product this image is associated with.

position.description: Position of the image in collection of images associated with a product.

status.description: Status if the image upload processing. Can be `processing`, `uploaded`, `error`.

product_id.description: The ID of the product associated with this inventory record.

outlet_id.description: The ID of the outlet associated with this inventory record.

reorder_point.description: Level at which a product should be automatically included in stock orders.

reorder_amount.description: Amount to be added to the automatic stock order.

data.description: An array of Inventory records wrapped in top level `data` object.

outlet_id.description: The ID of the outlet in which the count is taking place.

due_at.description: The date for which the count is scheduled.

show_inactive.description: Indicates whether inactive products should be included in the count.

name.description: The name of the inventory count

status.description: The status of the inventory count. One of: `STOCKTAKE_SCHEDULED`, `STOCKTAKE_IN_PROGRESS`, `STOCKTAKE_IN_PROGRESS_PROCESSED`, `STOCKTAKE_COMPLETE`.

filters.description: An array of filter objects. Max 25.

type.description: Consignment type, for inventory counts always `STOCKTAKE`

value.description: The ID of the filter object.

product_id.description: The ID of the product associated with this count item.

is_included.description: Indicated whether the item was included via a filter. Can be `null`. For full count (no filters) always `true`.

status.description: The status of the item. One of: `PENDING`, `SUCCESS`.

product_id.description: The ID of the product for which the count should be adjusted.

discount_total.description: Total discount for the line item.

is_return.description: Indicates whether this line item is a return from another sale (referenced by `return_for` on the main sale object).

cost.description: Unit cost for the line item.

cost_total.description: Total cost for the line item.

price_total.description: Total price for the line item.

tax.description: Unit tax for the line item. **deprecated** ???

quantity.description: Quantity of product units included in the sale.

tax_components.description: Collection of tax components associated with the line item.

discount.description: Discount. ??? Unit? Should that be even posted?

loyalty_value.description: The value that should be added to associated customer's loyalty balance.

price_set.description: Indicates whether the price was set manually. Using `true` means that the value will never be refreshed from the price book when reloaded (sale retrieved from parked sales).

sequence.description: Order of the line item in the sale.

default_tax_id.description: Default tax id used for sales in this outlet. **deprecated**

display_prices.description: Indicates whether prices in this outlet should be displayed as tax-inclusive.

data.description: An array of Outlet objects  wrapped in top level `data` object.

outlet_id.description: The ID of the outlet this record is associated with.

product_id.description: The ID of the product this record is associated with.

tax_id.description: The ID of the tax this record is associated with.

data.description: An array of outlet-product-tax records.

retailer_payment_type_id.description: A valid retailer payment type ID.

payment_type_id.description: A payment type associated with the retailer payment type. **deprecated** ???

name.description: The name of the payment type.

type_id.description: The ID of the global Vend payment type. It shouldn't be used to identify the payment type - there may be multiple payment types with the same `type_id`.

data.description: An array of payment types.

print.description: Indicates whether a receipt will be printed???

customer_group_id.description: The ID of the customer group

valid_from.description: The date when the price book becomes valid (active).

valid_to.description: The date when the price book becomes invalid (inactive).

outlet_id.description: The ID of an outlet for which the price book should be used.+ type: GENERAL (string) - Internal value. Safe to ignore.

customer_group_id.description: The ID of the customer group

valid_from.description: The date when the price book becomes valid (active).

valid_to.description: The date when the price book becomes invalid (inactive).

outlet_id.description: The ID of an outlet for which the price book should be used.

data.description: An array of price book objects wrapped in a top level `data` object.

product_id.description: The ID of the associated product.

price_book_id.description: The ID of the price book this product belongs to.

min_units.description: The minimum number of items for which this price will be used.

max_units.description: The maximum number of items for which this price will be used.

data.description: An array of price book objects wrapped in a top level `data` object.

handle.description: Product handle. **Note:** Variants share the same handle.

sku.description: Product sku. **Note:** Should be unique, but it's not verified while posting.

variant_parent_id.description: This value is set if a Product is a variant of another Product.

source.description: Indicates the origin of the product. Can be USER, SYSTEM, SHOPIFY.

active.description: Indicated whether the Product is active.

has_inventory.description: Indicates whether inventory is being tracked for the Product.

is_composite.description: Indicates whether the Product is a composite one.

description.description: A detailed description of the Product. **Note** Can contain HTML.

variant_options.description: A list of variant option objects.

data.description: An array of Product objects wrapped in top level `data` object.
An array of Product Type objects wrapped in top level `data` object.

code.description: Code for use in the promotion.

redeemed.description: Number of times this code has been redeemed.

Promotion.title: Promotion
Promotion.description: A Promotion defines rules and actions for discounting products as part of a sales promotion.

description.description: A short description for the promotion.

start_time.description: The time the promotion begins, in UTC, e.g. `2006-01-02T15:04:05`.

end_time.description: The time the promotion ends, in UTC, e.g. `2006-01-02T15:04:05`.

loyalty_multiplier.description: The loyalty multiplier for the promotion.

outlet_ids.description: A list of outlet IDs for the promotion.

channels.description: A list of outlet IDs for the promotion.

customer_group_ids.description: A list of outlet IDs for the promotion.

use_promo_code.description: Whether or not this promotion uses promo codes.

add_promo_code.description: A list of promo codes to associate with this promotion.

promo_code_summary.description: A summary of the added promo codes added.

data.description: A map of promo codes to booleans, wrapped inside a data object.
A map of promo codes to booleans, wrapped inside a data object.

PromoCodesMap.title: Map of Promo Codes to booleans

additionalProperties.description: A map of promo codes to booleans.

data.description: An array of codes which were not deleted.

status.description: Status field for the promo code.

data.description: An array of Promotion objects wrapped in top level `data` object.

description.description: A short description for the promotion.

outlet_id.description: A valid ID of an Outlet that this register is associated with.

print_receipt.description: Indicates whether a receipt should be printed after a sale.

email_receipt.description: Indicates whether a receipt should be emailed after a sale.

invoice_sequence.description: The numeric part of the last issued invoice.

is_open.description: Indicates if the Register is currently open.

register_open_time.description: Date/time when the register was open. Always in UTC.

register_close_time.description: Date/time when the register was closed. Null if currently open.

register_open_sequence_id.description: **internal** The ID of the current register closure object.

cash_managed_payment_type_id.description: **internal** The ID of the payment type used for cash management transactions in this regsiter.

data.description: An array Register objects wrapped in a top level `data` object.

RequestLog.title: Request Log
RequestLog.description: An object representing a single request and response made to a channel.

grouping_id.description: An identifier used to group together requests that occurred together as part of the same job or Vend API request.

request_method.description: The HTTP method used to make the request.

status_code.description: The HTTP status code received in the response.

request.description: A dump of the full request information in HTTP format, including headers and any request body.

response.description: A dump of the full response information in HTTP format, including headers and any response body.

error.description: f an error occurred with the request, such as an inability to resolve a hostname, connect or TLS errors, this will be recorded here. Only errors with the ability to make the request are logged here, rather than errors when interpreting a response.

occurred_at.description: An RFC3339 representation of the time at which the request was logged.

RequestCollectionResponse.title: Request Logs response
RequestCollectionResponse.description: A collection of request log records wrapped in the top-level data object.

RequestSingleResponse.title: Request Log response
RequestSingleResponse.description: A single request log record wrapped in the top-level data object.

outlet_id.description: Valid outlet ID for the retailer.

register_id.description: Valid register ID for the retailer.

user_id.description: Valid user ID for the retailer.

customer_id.description: Valid customer ID for the retailer.

invoice_number.description: Invoice number which if provided, should use the prefix and suffix defined for the register.

source.description: Origin of the sale. USER for sales created in Vend client apps, SHOPIFY for sale synced from Shopify by the integration, ECOMMERCE for sales coming from Vend Ecommerce.

source_id.description: External ID for sales coming from other systems

status.description: Sale status. One of: CLOSED, SAVED, ONACCOUNT, ONACCOUNT_CLOSED, LAYBY, LAYBY_CLOSED. VOIDED ???

short_code.description: 6 character code used in the loyalty system. ???

return_for.description: Reference ID to a different sale if this sale was created as a return.

total_price.description: Total (tax exclusive) price of the sale

data.description: An array of Sales wrapped in top level `data` object.
A collection of objects of one of the supported types: sales, products or customers.
An array of Suppliers wrapped in top level `data` object.
An array of Tag objects.

is_default.description: Indicates whether the tax is used as the default one.

display_name.description: The name of the tax used for display.

name.description: The name of the tax rate.

display_name.description: The name of the tax rate used for display.
Full user's name to be used for display in the UI.

email_verified_at.description: The timestamp of users email verification.

restricted_outlet_ids.description: A list of outlet IDs the user is associated with

seen_at.description: The timestamp of the user's last activity in the system.

target_daily.description: Daily sales target for the user.

target_weekly.description: Weekly sales target for the user.

target_monthly.description: Monthly sales target for the user.

is_primary_user.description: Indicated whether this user is the primary user for the account.

image_source.description: URL of the default-sized user's avatar.

data.description: An array of users.

UserImages.description: On object containing URLs for different sizes of the users avatar.
UserImages.title: User Image

UserResponse.title: User Response
UserResponse.description: A response for a single user GET request.

value.description: The value of a Variant Option.

Version.description: An object containing the highest and lowest version numbers for all items of the returned collection.

min.description: Lowest version number of the payload.

max.description: Highest version number of the payload.

adjustment.title: Adjustment
adjustment.description:
An adjustment contains a modification to the sale price. For example, it can be a service fee (fee when the customer pays by credit card) or a discount.
The types defined here are the one used so far, but we reserve the right to add others.

After.name: after
After.description: The lower limit for the version numbers to be included in the response.

Before.name: before
Before.description: The upper limit for the version numbers to be included in the response.

Deleted.name: deleted
Deleted.description: Indicates whether deleted items should be included in the response.

PageSize.name: page_size
PageSize.description: The maximum number of items to be returned in the response.
